Reviews.Title: “Much better than described by many others”
Reviews.Author: Muffingg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a 5 day trip to Berlin with family and it was an absolute great choice! The price is very reasonable for the amount of standards and service you get. The hotel staff is very nice and polite, as most 4/5 star hotels have and the rooms are spacious and tidy. We had a family suite, which had a lot of space, including a large walk-in-wardrobe and large bathroom. The beds were very comfortable and clean and the room service was great. People who say this hotel is far from the city centre, are completely wrong. Yes, you can't walk to the city centre, but you are a 4-6 minute walking distance away from one of the biggest stations in Berlin (Gesundbrunnen), from where it is just 5 stations to the Brandenburg gate, about 6 to Potzdamer Platz, and an 8 minute underground to Alexanderplatz, which are the main areas of Berlin. You can easily get to about anywhere in the city centre within 20min if you have to change. The area around the hotel was really nice: a lot of take-aways, a huge shopping centre (Gesundbrunnen-Center), grocery stores, and a big park for a walk right in front of the hotel. The only thing I could complain about is the prices of the breakfast, which if it isn't included costs around 17 Euros per person and is just way over the top. The Sauna and mini gym inside the building are great, even though very small. Overall, this hotel is a good hotel for a reasonable price and at a reasonable location with good service and rooms and I'd strongly recommend this to anyone on a budget and still wanting to have a pleasant stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Puffet
Reviews.Content: A fairly decent hotel, I have seen many more from the same franchise with better facilities but this place ticks all of the boxes and there is nothing to complain about. Front staff are friendly and helpful. We found that the breakfast at the corner place was half the price and a lot more value for money than the Hotel facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Ok room, far from the city center”
Reviews.Author: PrimeGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Hotel is obviously part of the Holiday Inn chain hence you are to be offered no surprises - neither good, nor bad. Normal sized rooms, nice bed and pillows, veeery small gym (the photo is very far from reality). The good parts are: public parking right in front (free during the weekend) and location very close to the subway station (2 minutes walk). The bad part is that it is quite far away from the city center to be able to get there on foot, hence not a good choice if you would like to do that. I went there twice as it always had by far the best price but I do not plan to go there for the third time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KCrC2011
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very convenient to Tegel Airport (approx 17 Euro cab ride - though the airport is closing this year) and the Besundbrunnen S-Bahn to get around the city. The staff were very friendly, rooms good and spacious and breakfast was good. The area immediately around the hotel was not great but it was great for transport and business needs. It was very noisy so you could not have the window open. The hotel was very good value for money though and we would recommend it for a convenient base.

Reviews.Title: “Ok room, out of the way location”
Reviews.Author: IntlEconTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at this property. Although the price is right, the location is not the best. Rooms are ok, clean and spaciius enough. There is a metro/s bahn station two blocks from the hotel, the service is slow late at night so if you are planning on being up in the city late at night stay somewhere else. There are plenty of small shops to buy water and goodies around the property, but nothing really interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: mariannecn
Reviews.Content: Recently on a weekend trip to Berlin to visit our daughter and new grand-daughter, we booked an inclusive deal with BA. Our expectations were not high, having not specially selected the hotel ourselves. However, we were in for a pleasant surprise. We found the hotel staff to be very friendly and helpful - they provide an excellent service for their guests. We have not always found this to be the case in other Berlin hotels, where the staff have been unfriendly and unapproachable. The breakfast buffet was of an extremely high standard and the dining room was very peaceful and calm. Our hotel room was quiet and spotlessly clean - I liked the "soft" and "hard" pillow option. A nice touch I thought. However, most impressive was the location - really great for transport and it really is in the "Mitte" ie very central. A lovely view on one side of the hotel meant that we could appreciate that whilst having our breakfast in the morning. We only spent 3 nights there but we would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: Hauxton
Reviews.Content: Fairly standard Holiday Inn type hotel - clean and functional (better than average mattresses and breakfast - buffet style - if you leave hungry then it's your own fault !) - BUT the real advantage of this hotel is it's location. Less than 5 minutes walk from Gesundbrunnen S-Bahn and U Bahn Stations (direct line to Potsdammerplatz and Friedrichstrasse). TIP: when leaving either S or U Bahn station, look up and do a '360' degree turn and you'll see the 'Holiday Inn' logo on top of the hotel - easy to locate. Also the hotel is close to the Gesundbrunnen Shopping Centre which is open until 8.00 pm (not Sundays of course - this is Germany after all !). Plenty of food outlets and Lidl/Aldi nearby for those water/shampoo/snack purchases that hotels charge too much for. I rate this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: 122sarah
Reviews.Content: Whilst on a recent holiday in Berlin, we stayed at the Holiday Inn Mitte. The staff are very friendly and helpful, and the rooms and hotel spotlessly clean. Would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Berlin. It is located in a central location, which makes it easy to travel around Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, No A/C, not in city”
Reviews.Author: jjstives
Reviews.Content: If you are just passing through Berlin and need a place to stay overnight, this is probably okay. But the four big negatives for us were: 1.No air conditioning, 2. Very, very noisy day and night as the hotel is practically on the railroad tracks 3. The neighborhood is less than ideal for walking around at night and 4. The distance to city center was much too far. (30 minutes on train.) Service was ok, average. Restaurant was avergae, but a bit slow with only two service persons working. Breakfast was too expensive to bother, so we bought rolls at nearby bakery. No way to make coffee or tea in room. Nothing special here and some staff were a bit cold. We asked for a quieter room and were told nothing available. After first night, we slept with ear plugs in because the U-Bahn, S-Bahn and regional trains all travel on below grade tracks not far from our window. At night, the walk from train station to hotel is not one for a single woman or with kids. The neighborhood is a little creepy and although there is a mall closeby, we did not find any restaurants we wanted to visit. There are other, better hotels that don't cost an arm and a leg closer in the city and without these problems. The strangest part was this hotel had four stars from Hotwire and was not, by any stretch of the imagination, deserving of this. I will not recommend this hotel and have blocked it from any future selection.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn, Mitte”
Reviews.Author: b991
Reviews.Content: The hotel was well located near shopping mall, opposite a park with parking space in front of the Hotel. Book your breakfast with your room if you want to have it later included it is rather expensive. In the streets near the Hotel are German Bakeries which have good deals for simple breakfast. The interior of the Hotel and the rooms are a little outdated.

Reviews.Title: “A bit old fashioned, but good service. Mall next door is good.”
Reviews.Author: gobitz
Reviews.Content: It's not downtown Berlin, but it's not as bad as people wrote. I got an upgrade (platinum), there's a very limited gym and sauna ( machines suck and could be replaced for something better). There are some weights and the breakfast is expensive (16 euro). I skipped and went to lidl and kaiser next door. Gesundbrunnen mall is good, and the shops in the badstrasse too.

Reviews.Title: “Average!”
Reviews.Author: Margaret2466
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a 3 night package, for us and our young son, as he was running the Berlin Marathon on the Sunday. Postives are that the hotel is in a great location for the tube and the train station. Literally when you come off the train you can see the hotel's signage. Also the mall nearby was very handy and also had a very reasonable italian restaurant within it. Negatives, there was no air conditioning in the room, just one fan. Even with the windows open all day and night, it was extremely stuffy in the room. This made getting a decent nights sleep very difficult. We found the breakfast at 16 euros which was not included in our tarrif, too expensive so instead chose to eat out of the hotel. There were cafes nearby which were much more reasonable. Despite being told that if we ate in the restaurant our son would eat free (as he was under 11) when we tried to use the restaurant on the Sunday night we were told we would have to pay for him as well - money making tactics over a marathon weekend! On the whole we thought the hotel to be in need of a bit of tlc. Staff were ok, but they questioned the rate my husband booked the hotel at, and instead of contacting reservations/loyalty club for us, he had to do it on a chargeable telephone number, not what he needed 24 hours before a marathon.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and convinient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Claudia2006
Reviews.Content: Very good and convinient hotel. I went there by car so I am not sure if it is convinient with public transport but parking was relatively easy to find free of charge. Rooms are quite big. Breakfast is very rich and delicious

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE READ ALL REVIEWS before booking this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LadyLev
Reviews.Content: First off I do not recommend this hotel. I am normally not that picky of a person when it comes to hotels but this was not what I expected at all. I got the hotel with a package deal through my travel agent. Otherwise I would have taken heed to all the other reviews about this hotel. My pros for the hotel were: • The breakfast buffet had a decent variety of food. The eggs weren’t the best but there was tons of fresh fruit and bread to choose from. There was also your typical German breakfast as well. • The staff in the dinning room were very attentive and remembered you each day you came in and what you drank. So they would make sure your table had it. For me this was a plus as they made sure my son had a glass of cold milk every morning. • One block from the train station. You can see the hotel sign as soon as you come off the U-bahn. (I recommend getting the Welcome to Berlin card. As it gives you unlimited access to the trains, trams and buses as well as discounts to various locations within Berlin and Potsdam.) My cons for the hotel were: • Room smelled stale as if someone had smoked in it earlier or something. • There was a requirement for a deposit for the room for the possibility that you would use the mini bar or order a movie on the TV. This fee was 35 Euros and it was refunded when you checked out as long as you didn’t use either or. • This hotel does not have AC which was a complete downer for me as it was really warm during the time I was in Berlin • There is not a safe in the room • When someone near your room goes into their room it can sound as if they are trying to come into yours • There was some street noise at night which someone mentioned in another post but it wasn’t as bad for me but I could understand how it could be a nuisance • The bathroom always sounds like there was water running so I was constantly running in there to make sure my son didn’t leave the water on. • And my biggest CON of them was the designated smoking area was right in the front lobby of the hotel. So as soon as you walk in on your immediate right the smokers were right there. There was no area closed off for it or anything. It was just wide open. I usually just held my breath until I got closer to the elevator. This is the first time I have stayed in a Holiday Inn like this. I wouldn’t have expected it to be so run down in a sense. The décor was old and need to be updated but I can ignore that if everything else is nice however that was not case. Someone did say something about the area being a little shady so to speak. It is in a Turkish area. I didn't have any problems but I could see how others would feel uncomfortable in the area. As far as I could tell as long as you didn't bother them, they didn't bother you. There is plenty of shopping in the neighborhood. There is also a mall right next to the train station with tons of stores to choose from. There are also vendors that setup during the day there so you can get fresh fruit and things like that. The fruit/veggie vendor was there pretty late most nights. As I noticed after coming in one night. Also, the mall normally closes at 9pm so you are able to get in there and get whatever you need. They do have a kids room in the lobby of the hotel but it was too close to the smoking area for me so I didn't allow my son to play in there. I did not eat dinner in the hotel so I am not sure how it was or cost. I noticed other reviews about the price so I just opted to make sure we ate before coming back or I grabbed snacks from the Real in the mall by the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: acik-pozisyon
Reviews.Content: Okay, it's Holiday Inn and it's a five star (at least known brand approach) hotel... Actually, I'm very disappointed when I see the hotel. It's outdated and uncomfortable... I pay approx. %20 more than average 3-4 star hotel for just convenience & comfort. Moreover, It wasn't included the breakfast. I do not suggest this hotel although I like Holiday Inn & Crown hotels group...

Reviews.Title: “Great location - would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Fred A
Reviews.Content: For Europe, this was a very spacious room. We stayed in a family suite, which gave us a great amount of room and allowed us to have the kids in one room (the living room) and us in the bedroom. The location is awesome - close to U/S bahn. It is in a Turkish neighborhood, which we liked because we love Doner Kebops. The only knock was that it is very close to a recycling center, which starts making noise at 7am. If you want to sleep in, this may be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly spacious family room !!!”
Reviews.Author: HipolitodlC
Reviews.Content: I had booked ( through HotDeals of HotWire ) a room for a family of 4 adults and what we found was an increadibly spacious family room consisting in fact of two internally connected big rooms ( each one with 2 individual beds , tv set , fridge , etc) , one very wide dressing room and a wide bathroom with all facilities but , above everything , the most positive surprise was how incredibly spacious the whole set up was . I would recommend this place to anyone looking for spacious family rooms. My only criticism on the hotel is that the name is misleading as it includes the name of a central district , creating the expectation that the hotel is actually located within it , when it is not . However , it is not badly located as the nearby underground station is only 4 stops from Alexanderplatz . There is a park literally in front of the hotel which is very convenient for jogging in the morning up to a couple of sightseeing places that overlook the whole city .

Reviews.Title: “close to metro; staff helpful for the most part”
Reviews.Author: nsadraz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located, close to the metro, mall and some restaurants. The staff are helpful for the most part, except one incident when I bought 3 hours worth of internet. However, the instructions were in German, and no one bothered to explain that there were download and timeline limitations. When I discussed the matter with the staff, I was told that it 'was not her problem.' Anyway, overall a decent hotel in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great stay”
Reviews.Author: PJW82
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not in Mitte but convenient for the light rail (U and S). Concrete building which was very hot and very noisy (close to main railway lines). No aircon but fan in room. Ask for a room in the back if you book for the hotel. Free internet with some room rates Breakfast was good

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel near good transport connections”
Reviews.Author: Numberoneguest
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times. It is very well connected to transport links at Gesundbrunnen with U bahn, S bahn and mainline train stations within a 5 minute walk. Links to both Alexanderplatz and Friedrichstrasse are excellent. Also across road is the large Gesunbrunnen Centre shopping mall. Staff are friendly. Had room on 7th floor which was a nice well maintained room. Reception area has been refurbished and is fairly functional but lounge areas to relax are limited. In hot weather you will need to have windows open and noise from trains and traffic is much more noticeable at front of hotel than at back.

Reviews.Title: “Looks dated but very good service”
Reviews.Author: ShropshireSue
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business, and my first impression when I walked in was that it looked extremely dated - if they just changed the carpet, they would transform the whole look of the lobby and the impression it gives. I also passed through some very pretty parts of Berlin in the cab on the way, and wished I had been staying there instead! The only food available on room service seemed to be a choice of two pizzas. So, there's the reason for the 'average' rating. Here are the good parts - the service is very good, the staff are friendly, and the food was excellent. The bedroom was absolutely fine. Nothing to write home about, but nothing wrong with it either. I can't say I would ever stay here on holiday, and the look of the place doesn't give a great impression for a business meeting either ... which is a shame for the people who work here, as they do a very good job and provide good food and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel well located for U and S bahn”
Reviews.Author: Wendy268
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via a British Airways City Break offer. Not knowing Berlin we did not know much about where we were staying as we booked due to a good price. Well, the taxi from airport was just €17, and the hotel was a 5 minute walk around the corner to the U and S bahn. There was a fantastic cafe by the hotel serving superb pretzels and coffee for just €3. The hotel is in a quiet street so was a peaceful nights sleep. the Gesundbrunnen bunker in nearby though we did not get a chance to see this on this visit. Hotel accommodation was as you would expect of Holiday Inn, comfortable, good hot shower and the staff were particularly helpful. Can't fault it, would stay again and am really not sure why this is so far down the Berlin hotel list on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but no frills”
Reviews.Author: lknewnes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights during a weekend trip to Berlin. The staff was very friendly, courteous and helpful which was very nice. The room itself was clean and comfortable. Wi Fi is available but you need to pay for it. There was no complimentary stuff available in the room, even the bottle of water was charged. The restaurant in the hotel was ok, the food was decent but there was a very limited selection available. The buffet breakfast was extensive and very good but very expensive at 16 Eur p.p. The hotel itself was 4 train stops from the city center and it took 5-10 mins to reach the city center. Overall it is a good and comfortable hotel with very friendly staff, but not many facilities available.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: AFoodLoverGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a pretty shoddy part of town. In saying that metro station is right around the corner and you can be in Alexanderplatz in 10 minutes. Bar/restaurant is pretty dire so head out if you want somewhere decent to eat and drink. Hotel has a gym but it a very basic, park across the road good for an early morning job but was told it is unsafe later in the evening! Rooms clean and tidy and staff very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot for a Historical Tour stay”
Reviews.Author: USarmyDAD
Reviews.Content: This was my first return to Berlin in 38 years. Dragged my two adult children here to tour the entire city. All of us are U.S. Army Officers and spent this hotel as our home base for a detailed tour of Berlin and the historical sites therein. The staff at the hotel spoke fantastic English and knew where to go for some of the more hidden historic sites right next to the hotel. Our room was very clean and quiet and was facing the shopping area and the FLAK Tower. The U-Bahn was just across the street. And for our shopping needs there was a large scale 'mall' right across the street. Be sure to tour the WW2 Bunker across the train tracks, it is worth the time and they have the tours in English. We will stay here the next time, which will be in 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, get a deal in advance”
Reviews.Author: UkE_b
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location - less than 5mins walk from the U-bahn and S-bahn station with a line direct into Alexandraplatz. Easy to navigate to from Tegel airport too - bus then train in about half hour. The room was immaculately clean, new fittings, good sized bathroom, lovely hot shower etc. The hotel was also quiet for being so central in the city. I got a deal in advance by booking flights and hotel together so it worked out cheaper. Hotel is a good option if there is more than one person to share the room (works out less than a hostel price) but a bit pricey if travelling solo (unless travelling on business expenses!). The hotel staff even left a Lindt santa at my room door on day of departure - St. Nicholas' day. Very thoughtful. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in a great location in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: matt303939
Reviews.Content: Ok so it is a bit misleading when they say 'Mitte', as it isnt in the centre of Berlin. But it is a 1 minute walk to the U-Bahn and S-Bahn, with a really good shopping centre as well, in the area of Gesundbrunnen. It is only 10 mins direct to Alexanderplatz and 10 mins to Charlottenburg. The hotel staff are very friendly and speak good English. It is impeccably clean. Our room was situated down a long maze of corridors with huge heavy fire doors every minute to tackle, not easy when u have a large suitcase to pull aswell. The rooms are a good size and modern, shame they dont have tea/coffee facilities. The shower was lush! The only criticism is the temperature in the room, one night boiling hot and the second night freezing cold. There was no thermostat and you couldnt open the windows, plus the walls are really thin and could hear everyone else's tv's at night. Overall though I would definitely stay here again if visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money with great S-Bahn/U-bahn connections!”
Reviews.Author: Memati
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a long weekend in Berlin. I must admit, as someone who lived in Berlin in the past, I was not sure where it was and how it was going to pan out. I did read all the comments before but let me tell you: this hotel is clean and has very friendly staff,. It is literally opposite the station- just 2 min walk to the Gesundbrunnen (Ubahn-S bahn) station or 5 min to Pankow U-bahn. Gesundbrunnen has great connections so you won't be disappointed.. There is a Le Femme Breakfast place/caffee (simit house) next door and it is excellent. There are plenty of take-aways and there is also groceries, supermarkets of many different kind just around you. It is not in Mitte though, rather it is in Wedding. However it takes 5 min to Alexander Platz and 10-15min to Postdamer Platz. When you get a good deal for the room, do not miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: LiHamJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice now and both times have been great. Both times was the best price I could find in almost whole of Berlin for hotel of this standard. Only thing really missing was a nice pool. Don't bother with breakfast (or any other meal) instead go to local cafe/restaurant Lichtberg just around corner from Gesundbrunnen Centre on Behmstr (2 mins from hotel), every meal I've had here has been excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fine but the location is not”
Reviews.Author: jwp48
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Berlin Mitte is not in one the best locations. There are no reasonable restaurants, cafes or bars nearby but fortunately is only about 5 minutes walk to the U / S Bahn station. The hotel itself is fine, rooms are reasonable and a good selection at the breakfast buffet. Staff are friendly and helpful. Rates are usually quite good - probably to make up for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: pixie0427
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Mitte stands right in front of a charming little city park and within a couple of minutes walking to all major conveniences including a mall, supermarkets, restaurants, convenience stores, ATMs and the Gesundbrunnen train/U-Bahn (metro)/S-Bahn station complex which allows easy access to the entire city as well several fast long-distance (RE) trains. The area feels safe yet quiet; people are on the street late into the night, something that appears quite typical of Berlin in the Fall. The rooms are somewhat small but make efficient use of the space. There was no air-conditioning - and it did not appear at all necessary given the pleasant days and near-freezing nights - but one would not want to be staying there if the weather warms up beyond 30°C. The staff were prompt, efficient and courteous - but as with all other hotels we stayed at in Germany, we had to specially request a tea-kettle for the room. The breakfast was lavish; we did not have any other meals there as we spent all our days exploring Berlin and its surroundings. There was so much to see and do that 4 days just flew by, and we could have easily spent 14 more.

Reviews.Title: “Its a great value for money place.”
Reviews.Author: sdutta55
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located next to one of the imp. Berlin stations. So moving around in the city is quite easy. The hotel has good spacious rooms with view and also have a nice playing area for the kids. the rates are reasonable and if you are a budget traveller who do not want to compromise on quality as well then this is the hotel to pick. The service is good. The hotel also offers internet browsing facility at a nominal charge with free print outs. This is very helpful for independant travellers and not part of any package tour.

Reviews.Title: “Better 3 stars but not 4”
Reviews.Author: Fero967
Reviews.Content: The hotel is less than expected, only one old lift, very slowly - complication for all clients. As common by Holiday Inn the for breakfast is nice selection, however one morning we have to wait 5-10 minutes for getting free place at the table. Maybe only accidentally but I had to wait for check-out for nearly 20 minutes, till I could be proceeded. I came from Dresden where I was in Hotel Orbis with only ** but more convenient than Holiday Inn with his ****. For Internet connection, which use to be inclusive, I paid 10€ for 10hours. The position is neutral, because everywhere you have to travel. Tray rather some else hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quite nice. Good restaurant with fair prices”
Reviews.Author: RoccoSiffredi1968
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Berlin Mitte is actually located a bit away from Mitte near the S-Bahn station Gesundbrunnen in a residential area. I stayed there several times in 2008 and 2009. The Hotel itself is not exactly pretty from the outside, but quite functional from the inside. The rooms are clean, the beds are nice. The hotel restaurant is actually pretty good and the food is very reasonable priced for a hotel restaurant. Breakfast is very good as well. All in all the Holiday Inn Berlin Mitte can definitely be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very polite & friendly staff, rooms very clean & welcoming!!”
Reviews.Author: redvelvetroses
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely with very friendly staff (some speak English, some don't), the rooms are cleaned to a very high standard every day, smoking room is available in the foyer, however......to have any meals in the restaurant was exceedingly expensive. It would be wise to eat elsewhere if you are on a budget. If your room is facing the front of the hotel it is rather noisy at night until about midnight, as it is located in a busy area. Nevertheless, the hotel is suitable for a trip to Berlin, easy access to the underground..........just a stone's throw away..........as is all public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: shortygc
Reviews.Content: If you are traveling with a group as we were, we had to porter our own luggage to our rooms. The hotel did not furnish this. The down side was when we arrived we were told we had to go outside the building and up some stairs to get to the elevator to our rooms and there was no air condition. One person in the group called about air conditioning and they said they had it. When we arrived it was in the common area, not the rooms. Good grief Holiday Inn. You can do better than this!

Reviews.Title: “Just a few things that may spoilt the experience.”
Reviews.Author: mozip78
Reviews.Content: To start with the good points. The staff were very helpful, and accommodating (especially for large groups). It was clean, the breakfast was good (decent buffet to cater for most people). The usual facilities were there; decent shower, towels, clean linen, etc, etc. Unfortunately the downsides caused me to mark it down considerably. Temperature – There is no air-conditioning or fans, and the hotel seems to absorb the heat. The windows only open slightly so you have to ask for a key to get them fully open, otherwise it's unbearable. Even with this, it was very hard to sleep. Location – yes it is in Mitte, but really on the edge of Mitte, and not a particularly nice bit. If you want to be in the centre of things this is not the place to be. But you are very near a underground and overground train station, so it's easy to get into town. This is essentially a very basic hotel, that is dressed as a four-star. It's just not somewhere you'd want to hang around in that much. Given the choice I'd pick a nice hostel (with private room) in more central mitte, next time. Much better value for money. But, for the ease of booking in a large group (such as a stag party) it would fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, practical hotel”
Reviews.Author: maheshfromgoa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a few hundred metres from the Berlin Gesundbrunnen station. We booked a triple and were allotted Room 123. The reception desk was nice and efficient. The lift to the first floor took us to a landing from where we had to climb down half a flight of stairs and before arriving at the room. Doing this with heavy luggage was a pain.. so avoid this floor if you can. The room was very practical and bathroom had a shower-cabin instead of a bath-tub. The breakfast was nice and plentiful. We paid Euro 99/day and were pretty happy. Internet is one euro per 15 minutes. Programmes on TV were only in German language, I wish they carry some english channels also. Overall a satisfactory experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but charged extra € 20 for my wife in our double room!”
Reviews.Author: Hekator
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean. The reception was polite and friendly. The bed was good. I booked online a double room for 2. It was € 79. When I check out they charged me € 20 extra for my wife. It was only us two in the room and I book a room for two. That was a sleazy extra charge. The TV in the room also did not work properly. Breakfast was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy place”
Reviews.Author: made_in_ukraine
Reviews.Content: The location is a bit far from the city center, yet easily reachable by S-bahn. The rooms are spacious and clean. Bathroom had all necessary items. The breakfast is one of the most delicious I have ever had. While being somewhat expensive (ca. 13 EUR), the buffet features a variety of options. Overall, a nice experience if the price is right

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired, but good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Belgian-Brussels
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly, the rooms are clean, the location is OK , the price is very good for this Berlin location if you include that there is a free sauna (and very mini gym). The rooms are a bit old and the overall atmosphere shows a little bit the "70s", certainly the stairs & lift area's. Restaurant is good quality although the choice is a bit limited. Overall good value for money in a practical (if not trendy) location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, alright rooms”
Reviews.Author: iMtrippinUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some friends during a girls' trip to the Christmas markets. This hotel was a great value in a good location. We took a taxi from Berlin-Shonefeld Airport, which cost about 45 euro for 7 people. The neighborhood is primarily Turkish, so unless you want kabob for dinner, you should hop on the U-Bahn and head elsewhere for restaurants. The station, on both U-Bahn and S-Bahn routes, was about a 5 min walk from the hotel. One of the gentlemen working the front desk was absolutely fantastic. He gave great directions to the places we wanted to go and made recommendations for places he thought we'd like. With his directions, we didn't get lost once. He even told us about discount train tickets so it only cost each of us about 4 euro for one day of travel, and then 2 euro for the entire weekend. The rooms left a lot to be desired. The hairdryers weren't very great and decoration was sparce. But, we booked the place based on location and price and were happy with what we had. We only slept and showered in there before leaving to sightsee. The staff made up for what the rooms lackd. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: impressa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near to Underground Station Gesundbrunnen. Its convenient for travellers to travel around and to and from the Central train station (Hauptbahnhof). The hotel staff were courteous and always there to help. I've requested for a late checkout as my train was departing in the afternoon. They gladly extended the room check out to 2.00 pm. Breakfast was also good. Best of all the breakfast hall is big enough to accomodate the hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Screenname48
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. I found the staff very friendly and very efficient. It's good value for money - not in a glamorous area (which would no doubt increase the price) but close to (incredibly efficient) public transport services and very well maintained. I thought the hotel provided very good value for money. I will certainly consider staying there if I have occasion to revisit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Was Terribly Rude - Will not Return!”
Reviews.Author: rickyaciii
Reviews.Content: I doubt I would ever stay at this hotel again. While the hotel was clean and roomy, a staff member was horrendously rude to my family and I and it appears to me that an attempt was made to overcharge us. To preface this, I have traveled in Europe before and consider myself a good traveler – I know it is not home and that things are different, and I embrace that aspect. I also prepare ahead and check my facts carefully, so this horrible experience was a complete surprise. On this occasion, I was traveling with my family of five (three adults and two teenagers). We booked our room on Holiday-Inn’s website, which described it as a, “…FAMILY SUITE…” for, “…5 PERSON(S) MAX PER ROOM…” When I booked, I clearly indicated that we were a party of three adults and two children. The quoted rate, confirmed in my confirmation e-mail, was €149 + €20 (labeled as, “Extra Persons Charge / Night.”) = €169. Prior to coming to the hotel, I called Holiday Inn’s international desk (I do not know the exact name of this department), and confirmed that the ages of the children would not place them in “adult” status at the hotel. I do not think that it was the desk agent who misinformed me, as the events that transpired the day I checked in seem to indicate a hotel-based problem. Per my reservation, my family arrived on October 8. We all entered the lobby together around noon; checked in; verified the number of people, rate, and charges; and signed for our rate. We were advised that our room was not ready, and that we could access it after three. I emphasize that we checked in at this time, and we verified the rate and extra charges with the clerk. At approximately 9:15 the same night we returned from an exhausting day in Berlin and approached the front desk to pick up our key. A different clerk was working. The clerk advised us that we would need to pay €15 extra for each of the two children (for a total of €30 extra) as the hotel’s policy was that each extra child had to pay. I politely advised the clerk that we had booked the room at a rate of €149 plus an additional €20 for the adults, that we had indicated the presence of two children when reserving, that we were not eating breakfast at the hotel, and that the international desk of Holiday Inn had confirmed that the children would not be considered adults. The clerk’s tone then became, in my perception, very, very rude, and frankly I perceived the clerk’s attitude to be disparaging. The clerk advised us that in addition to our quoted rate we must pay €30 total for the two children. I offered to show the clerk my confirmation e-mail, but the clerk refused, advising us again of the need to pay €30 extra. The clerk then advised us that the clerk believed that we were getting an excellent “deal.” I asked the clerk why it was that we were not informed of the additional €30 charge when we checked in earlier in the day, and the clerk stated that the charge simply had to be added. I further advised the clerk that had we been told of the charge in the morning when we checked in, I could have sought another hotel with a more reasonable rate during the day. The clerk then had the audacity to say, in what I perceived to be a very rude tone, “You would leave over 30 euros?” This was stated in front of other guests, and with one of the children in our party present. I advised the clerk that we would, and that we would like for the staff to seek another hotel. Finally, the clerk looked over our records, and indicated that since I am an ICH priority member, the charges would be waived. I should add that it seems audacious that the hotel charges an extra fee for each person after the first adult in a family suite, and that while the fee is €10 for adults, it is €15 for children over 12. I personally suspect that the employee interpreted the hotel policy incorrectly, or that the hotel was trying to add fees inappropriately.

Reviews.Title: “a handy spot for a quick visit”
Reviews.Author: DublinSupersaint
Reviews.Content: just back from a 2 day break in this hotel, and have to say really enjoyed my stay here, just a note the address of this hotel is mitte but i think its more in the wedding district as i found when i did my traveling however don't let this put you off. the area is fine and there is a train & underground 15 seconds walk which has easy access to central berlin. also in the area outside the hotel there are shops to suit all plus a large shopping center, on the hotel its self we had a twin room which was fine not very big but done the job also very clean, minibar if required one thing to note here is there is bottled water on your table which i thought was free but on close inspection they was a €3! charge, i did not eat in the hotel so can say anything about the food the staff were very friendly and the check in was hassle free as was check out would defo stay here again as i worked out my routes for the things i wanted to do in berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Nice Staff, Interesting Location”
Reviews.Author: GOGraffer
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn-Mitte of Berlin is a good place to stay in Berlin for a number of reasons: (1) It's a good value. When compared to other mid-level hotels in Berlin, it's hard to beat. I paid about 90-Euros per night with breakfast included during the peak of the tourist season. (2) The staff at the desk and in the restaurant was efficient, cheerful, and helpful. With very limited skills in speaking German, they didn't hesistate to switch to English when I faltered. They were very precise in going over my charges before finalizing the bill (something not all hotels do!). (3) The location is interesting in that it's in a normal, everyday part of Berlin with a distinct mix of residents of Turkish, German, and eastern European ancestry. It's not really in the "Mitte" area and not in walking distance of the city's favorite tourist sites; it's actually in the Wedding area just a few blocks from the Gesundbrunnen Center. Nevertheless, with the U- and S-Bahn station at Gesundbrunnen, you're virtually within a 10-minute train ride to the various attractions such as Brandenburger Tor, the Reichstag, and Checkpoint Charlie. (4) The property is clean, well-maintained. My room was spotless. (5) The breakfast buffet is very nice. The only negatives I can think of is the noise from the airport (Tegel) if you leave your windows open (necessary during the summer if the temps are warm, since there is no AC) and a limited selection of restaurants in walking distance. On my next trip to Berlin, I'll definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough hotel, basic and close to U-Bahn”
Reviews.Author: DavidH9190
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the Holiday Inn, Mitte in December 2007, it is a nice enough hotel, quite basic, however the room was clean and the staff were friendly. The hotel is just off a main street with plenty of local shops, bakeries etc. The hotel is situated across from the 'Gesundbrunnen' underground, city train and railway station of the Deutsche Bahn, so travelling to and from the city centre is no problem. A 30 minute walk takes you right into the heart of the city centre. The local area has a very Turkish influence which although was off putting at first turned out to be quite enjoyable, the local Turkish cafes/bakeries were nice and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We went to Berlin in December to experience the Christmas markets, this in itself was a great experience and is thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast EVER!”
Reviews.Author: LizyAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Really a great hotel! Free sauna and gym, clean rooms and a very very very great breakfast! Neighbourhood was not so good, and there wasn' t a lot to do. Very close to the U and S bahn, which can take you to everywhere. I would really recommend this hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing for the money”
Reviews.Author: hansardtony
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights @119 E per night (99 + 20 extra person).Had room 809 which was smoking when non requested. Breakfast OK but monotonous - same every day. Dinner the same every night ! However large choice of restaurants locally. Very good for trains into town / airports / Sacchenhausen etc. Room carpet very stained but cleaners in every day.Would choose alternative next time.

Reviews.Title: “There Are Better Hotels”
Reviews.Author: stuart462
Reviews.Content: August in Berlin can be hot, and a sunny south facing room with no air conditioning can be horrible, which this, as a result was. Perhaps at other times of the year this would not be an issue. At least you can open the windows nice and wide but installing air-con would help a lot! It's a hotel with eight accomodation floors and ONE lift. That's just not enough. Nothing can be done about that! The breakfast room also didn't appear to cope too comfortably with all the guests, but that could just be because it was quite full. Maybe slightly smaller tables but more of them might help? The bedside lights were too far over to the bed and I kept banging my head on the lampshade. They need to be higher up. They changed the name to "Mitte" recently, which reflects the administrative district, not what most folk would call the Mitte. A bit like saying Swiss Cottage is "Camden" because it's in the London Borough Of Camden! How about Holiday Inn - Gesundbrunnen? There are very few dining opportunities nearby unless you like kebabs or fast food. On the plus side, it's near Gesundbrunnen S and U Bahn stations and an indoor shopping centre. Staff seemed okay, some quite freindly and helpful. Rooms seem spacious and bathroom okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, although we had some complications”
Reviews.Author: Traveller21345
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Holiday Inn for one week in April for sightseeing purposes. The hotel is less than 5 minutes from a subway station, which easily connects you to all of the major sites in Berlin. There are also at least 2 bakeries on the way to the subway, which made for decent, very cheap breakfasts. The hotel surroundings were very quiet and we never had a problem with noise. The room itself was small, but clean and well maintained for the entire week that we were there. The bathroom did have a bit of a funny smell, but it did not permeate into the rest of the room. We had a non-smoking room and had no problem with residual smoke smells or perfume used to cover up smoke smells (as stated in some earlier reviews). My main complaint is that we had some major billing issues. I had booked the room online through the hotel website. I brought my printout from the website with me and this printout included a total price that had to be paid. Despite this, the hotel insisted on charging me 10 euros more per night (this was after the extra person fee had already been taken into account). On 4 separate occassions I had to argue with the staff and show them my printout. On each occassion, I was told that I was correct and that the bill would be fixed. However, this only lasted until the next shift started, and then I had the same problems again. The problem even persisted through my departure and I had to work on the situation from home via e-mail. In the end, the problem was fixed and an appropriate refund was made. Outside of the billing problems, I thought that the hotel was a great value for the price, especially considering its close location to the subway. I assume that the billing problems were a freak event, so I would actually recommend this hotel to others. As for myself though, it gave me such a headache that I may try a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “"Good location - Good value for money"”
Reviews.Author: damosp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Holiday inn Berlin Humboldt Park Hotel from 16-02-07 to 19-02-07. We were three couples. The purpose of out trip was the sightseeing of Berlin. The hotel is opposite the metro (Gesundbrunnen station), 4 stops from Alexander-Platz. The neighbourhood is very quiet and full of eating places so you do not really need a breckfast. You can also use the stores in the Gesundbrunnen Centre – big mall centre outside the Gesundbrunnen station (Open from 08:00-22:00, food stores open around 09:00 and most of the stores at 10:00 - closed on Sundays). The rooms were clean, well decorated and functioned. The bed was comfortable but the quilt was short and narrow. We solved that problem by putting on maximum the heating. The breakfast was nice, but we suggest the food from the streets… The main advantage of this hotel was the staff: Friendly, polite, quick and efficient. They really tried to be helpful in every way. They helped us in ticket issuing and gave us directions for the metro and sightseeing. We would definitely stay to that hotel in the future because is a great value for money. Some tips about the transport and the city: The metro system and especially trains (S-Bahn) is quite complicated so do your homework before travelling, then visit the information store at the airport (any airport), ask there anything you need and take the necessary maps. Even Schonefeld airport is located inside zone B, so you will probably only have to use a ticket for AB zones only for going from the airport to the city center. The WelcomeCard 2007 [--] is probably a wise choice for a 2 or 3 days stay, but check it at the information store. If you miss that, you won’t have the opportunity to ask anybody at the train station (at least at Schonefeld airport). Be careful: There is also the CityTourCard 1-2€ chipper but probably the Welcome Card is much better as it has more discounts that the CityTourCard [--]. At train station there are only automatic machines issuing tickets (and the cards) but as you will probably find a lot of people queuing there it will not be possible for you to have a throughout look of the system and understand it. We did not have a good search at the machines but it looks like that some machines sell the Welcome card or CityTourCard and other ones no so, be careful!! Each time you use a train, double check the correct platform and the correct train which I am not quite sure how you will find it (prefer to find a German to ask but not expect much especially if you do not speak good German). We experienced people telling as wrong info and others giving the correct ones even in the same wagon :( A convenient way to have a quick look of the city centre are bus lines 100 and 200. Many people do not speak English for example at Potsdam Hauptbahnhof info store, but they print you the schedule of the trains (it depends on your skills though to find the correct train). If you are going to visit the Sanssouci Palace and the rest of palaces at Potsdam, be prepared that the tour is guided only in German language. They give you a brochure in English, but most of the telling remains a mystery to you (Especially when people ask things, etc)! Of course you pay for a guided tour and they do not allow you to do it by yourself!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: Vardomannen
Reviews.Content: Good location within easy reach of all of Berlin's major sights. However this didn't compensate too much for the step back in time. I lived in Warsaw for a while in the early 1990's and was transported back to my younger days by the interior and smells of this hotel. There was something strange and somewhat surreal about the whole experience. The corridors smelled as if they hadn't been aired - a kind of musty / stagnant water smell. The wide corridors also reminded me of East European public buildings of a bygine era. Once into the room however, the smell and ambience disappeared. This is one of the more standard Holiday Inns I've stayed in, although for a price of 79 Euro in the centre of berlin, I suppose you get what you pay for. I got no recognition as a Platinum Card Holder - the hotel may well have been fully booked or something, but no explanation was forthcoming (I speak fluent German, so it wasn't due to language difficulties). On the plus side; the room was clean and functional. Nothing more, nothing less. No tea/coffee facilities (am I getting to demanding in my old age?), and a minimum amount of towels in the room (or was there just one towel - I forget) but there are plenty of cafes and restaurants in the area, mostly Turkish / Asian, but the ones I tried were good. The hotel is a 5-minute-walk from the train station at Gesundbrunnen from where you can access any part of Berlin. Would I recommend it? If you're looking for a fairly basic, but clean hotel, in what seemed like an OK area of town and can get a good rate, then go for it. If you're expecting anything unusual, extraordinary, spectacular or rememberable, then go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay at for the cityshopper”
Reviews.Author: morrisen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite, and paid 26 € each/night. The suite had a nice bathroom, a livingroom and a bedroom. The location is good for moving around in Berlin, especially since Berlin really doesn´t have a really specific center. It was only 22 min from Tegel Airport with TXL bus to Beusselstrasse, and S-bahn to Gesundbrunnen. I would stay here again when looking at value for money, and have no complaints worth mentioning. p.s. in Berlin there is no need to include the breakfast in the price, you can just as well grab something from one of the many bakeries you can find at any s / u-bahn.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel-Good location”
Reviews.Author: Garamanda
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well located for further travel around Berin. The Hotel itself was clean and staff were helpful and friendly. I had booked a family room that was spacious and suited our needs. We had the buffet breakfast within the hotel that was priced at 14 Euros per adult. Our children, (both under 16) eat for free. The breakfast was very good, with a huge variety of food that catered for all tastes. We had one evening meal at the restaurant that frankly was a let down. Go else where. We had a fantastic time at the Christmas markets-we found that food, drink and fairground rides were very reasonably priced. Here's a tip-The stalls selling beer, mulled wine etc at the markets charge an additional 2 euro deposit per glass or mug which isn't that well advertised. So don't put your glass on the bar and walk away without collecting your deposit!!

Reviews.Title: “Smoking - Non Smoking”
Reviews.Author: Zurich
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite at a very reasonable rate (€56 w/out breakfast). Arriving at 12.30 we were even allowed into the room - which smoked badly after smoke. The staff were sorry and reaccomodated us into a non smoking suite, which proved to be two rooms with four beds each instead of a separate living room. We were not happy at all. Later in the afternoon the (new) receptionist told us that the first room would have been a non smoking room and she was looking for a solution. Meanwhile we were offered a free cup of coffee. She came up with a non smoking suite opposite to the first room. Well, the way it smelled it was a quickly over perfumed smoking room but we did not object. Later in the night I heard a funny noise as if someone would try to get into our room. When I opened the door (with the "do not disturb" tag at the handle) I met a very surprised couple which said that they are assigned to this room. The receptionist wrote down a wrong number (it was the opposite room instead, our first one). The second morning (Sunday) we tried the breakfast buffet. The restaurant looks a bit dark on enterin it but has some natural light in the rear. The tables are quite big and there is enough space between them. The buttet is ok, not really good, not really bad. The service personnel was close to being unkind, what I found annoying. The location is good because it is close to the underground and S-Bahn Gesundbrunnen. This station is served by the circle line (S-Bahn) and the north-west-connection going to Friedrichstrasse. The underground serves Alexanderplatz. Next to the hotel is the entrance to a historic tunnel system built during war time. It can be visited by guided tours. All in all, the hotel is good if you want clean and bright rooms and that's it. Plus a location with absolutely no glamour and no trend-setting, just a genuine north berlin setting - absolutely authentic.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarenVABeach
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean. The staff was very patient and helpful. We didn't bother with the restaurant because there are several restaurants and bakeries within walking distance. Great location. There is a huge mall (by German standards) right next tothe hotel. The U-bahn is also a few steps away. It wasn't hard to navigate our way to the sites.
